summary: The 'Save Our Shipyards Act of 2025' (H.R. 2125) proposes to establish a National Commission on the Maritime Industrial Base (SOS Commission). This commission will investigate and study the state of the U.S. maritime industry, focusing on shipyards, shipbuilding, workforce, and national defense needs. It will then recommend policies to the President and Congress aimed at strengthening the industry, revitalizing the naval fleet, fostering shipbuilding, and safeguarding maritime jobs. The Commission will consist of 15 voting and 7 non-voting members and will issue a report with recommendations within a year of its first meeting.
